comment: Rude to students. Didn't personally teach (expected you to read). Assigns three conflicting theories in the form of  100$ text that are NOT qualitative. Very opinionated and not open-minded. Needs people and teaching skills. Assigned quizzes every day, having up to 20 questions only offering 10 minutes time. One cumulative final exam (1 hr long).
New teacher. Very difficult to make anything higher than a C. Take someone else.

This teacher is new and does not know how to grade. I don't think I've ever seen this many people drop a class. Extremely tough grader and difficult to talk to. I worked so hard and couldn't get anything better than a C to save my life. Do not take! Beware.

just awful. new professor, very very strict and enforced no cell phonecomputer policy. she gives very extensive pop quizzes to be completed in 10 minutes. the work load was almost ridiculous. she's not very approachable, so don't expect her to work with you. harsh grader. I dropped the class to spare my GPA. DO NOT TAKE!!

This teacher is one of the worst I've ever had. I had to end up dropping the class. She is not specific at all in what she expects in assignments. She makes assignments look simple if you just follow the rubric, but then docks off points for things that aren't even on the rubric. DON'T TAKE!!!!

I had to drop this class because the teacher required too much  and with my work load for school and my job it just did not work for me. However this teacher is crazy with the amount of homework, she would require two discussion post due by 7pm the night before the next class. Also, she would bash your questions if they did not meet her standards.

This professor was new and she was extremely strict on discussions and assignments, meaning if you post exactly what she says to do, she has a certain way of grading it.  She is super strict about even having a phone out on a desk even if it is turned over, she will call you out to remove it from your desk.  She doesn't allow laptops, tablets, etc
